result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachariah M Lucas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Zachariah M Lucas is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Zachariah M Lucas was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.  To be collected by the Department of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
$250 DNA surcharge remitted. $268  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.
Maintain full-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment.
Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with JC.

Completion of certified domestic violence treatment.  Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

supervisions.notes:
Concur to 15CF571.  Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
11/8/17 Crt orders def is to receive a Total of 283 days credit NOT in addition to the 188 days currently listed. Crt also corrects the case # listed concur from 15CF571 to 15CF2571 All other conditions remain the same.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain full-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment.
Psychiatric/psychological evaluation as deemed appropriate by agent and treatment as recommended.
Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample-on file.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.
